page.title: 08Media (Local News May 1985)
page.content: A Whitstable man was knocked down by a car,then brutally attacked by three thugs as he walked home.A teenager's happiness at having got engaged turned to terror when he was punched in the face after being forced to stop his car in the High Street.Seasalter residents lack of interest for fund raising events for a Community Centre was blamed for a poor turn out at a sponsored walk in which only 10 people came.A frieghter which has only just returned to service has made its first appearance in Whitstable Harbour. Another piece of Whitstable heritage disappeared in a cloud of dust and rubble when the former St.Peter's Church in Bexley St. was demolished. Local residents will be effected by Health Service cuts which mean 1000 fewer operations at Canterbury Hospital.
